text: Joan Colom i Altemir (April 1921Profile of Joan Colom – 3 September 2017) was a Spanish photographer. He was born in Barcelona. Colom was known for his portraits of Barcelona's underworld and working class, especially in the infamous neighbourhood of Raval. Colom was a self-taught photographer, and produced his best-known pictures while working during the week as an accountant. In 1957 he became a member of the Agrupació Fotogràfica de Catalunya (AFC), and co-founded in 1960 the artist's group El Mussol ("The Owl"). Colom died in Barcelona on 3 September 2017 at the age of 96. ==References== ==Other websites== *El País article Category:1921 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Spanish photographers Category:Artists from Barcelona
